meanings.definition: Emitting rays of light or heat.
meanings.sent1: The sunflower stood tall, its raying petals shining brightly in the sunlight.
meanings.sent2: The raying warmth of the campfire kept us cozy on the cool evening.
meanings.sent3: The raying smile on her face lit up the room with joy.
meanings.sent4: The raying beams of the lighthouse guided ships safely to shore.
meanings.sent5: The raying stars in the night sky twinkled like diamonds.

meanings.sent1: The raying lines on the painting gave it a sense of depth and movement.
meanings.sent2: The raying pattern of the spider's web was intricate and beautiful.
meanings.sent3: The raying spokes of the bicycle wheel spun quickly as he pedaled down the street.
meanings.sent4: The raying branches of the tree reached out in all directions, providing shade.
meanings.sent5: The raying colors of the sunset painted the sky in a breathtaking display.

meanings.definition: Expressing or showing in a radiant manner.
meanings.sent1: Her raying personality filled the room with positivity and warmth.
meanings.sent2: The raying bride looked stunning in her white gown on her wedding day.
meanings.sent3: The raying artwork on the walls brightened up the dull office space.
meanings.sent4: His raying enthusiasm for the project inspired the whole team to work harder.
meanings.sent5: The raying smile on the child's face melted the hearts of everyone around.
